Summary: Fast moving star-like object traveling at incredible speeds from East to West.
divs: sighting detailsfirst, i see a lot of ufos on a regular basis. this one stands out by far. at around 11:30 to 12:30, i was looking at the stars (as i usually do) and see a very faint, very dim light shooting across the sky. i was able to see the international space station a few weeks ago (california), and i think it travels around 17,000 mph. at that altitude, this ufo had to have been going at least 6-10 times the speed of the iss. i first saw it while looking at the normal constellations i see. i am looking basically straight up, and i see movement. i focus on the movement, and realize how fast it is going first. its very dim, and looks very large, almost as if i have an out of focus view on a star; but traveling at amazing speeds. i would say it would cross from horizon to horizon (maintained at an average speed) in less than 4 minutes. i've never seen any ufo travel so fast, and making it difficult to see makes me believe it's extra-terrestrial instead of government craft. this occurred for about 15 seconds, at which point it went dim and i could no longer see it (i have 20\20 vision and am far sighted, so i see these better than a lot of my friends). it seemed to have maneuvered to the south, but just barely. a small correction of flight trajectory, if you will. i had no emotions other than excitement and amazement that i was able to see this. my friend from inside heard me as i said in awe things along the lines of "what is that?" and "i've never seen any ufo do that" and came outside to see what i was saying. it disappeared shortly before that unfortunately. somewhat of an oval shape, but hard to distinguish. it looked very out of focus, and very dim.
trends: There have been 4 other sightings in San Dimas
There were no other sightings in San Dimas on or around January 27th 2011
